DOC.brief_summary: Use versus non use of urinary catheterization during Second Elective caesarean delivery:
DOC.brief_title: Catheterization During Second Elective Caesarean Delivery
DOC.detailed_description: Evaluation OF use versus non use of urinary catheterization during Second Elective caesarean delivery:by urine analysis 24 hours postoperative to exclude urinary tract infection.
DOC.criteria: inclusion criteria pregnant females who will undergo second elective caesarean section at full term pregnancy (38:41 weeks gestational age). Women with history of more than one previous caesarean Section. Women with history of a tonic postpartum hemorrhage. Women with Urinary tract infection in present pregnancy. Women with diabetes mellitus in present pregnancy. Women with medical disorder in present pregnancy that obligate monitoring of urine output during and after caesarean section, such as severe preeclampsia or renal disease with pregnancy. Emergency caesarean section
